revision.text:
{{Infobox given name | name = Danilo | image = | image_size = | caption = | pronunciation = | gender = Male | meaning = "God is my judge" | region = | language = | origin = Hebrew | alternative spelling = | nickname = | related names = [[Daniel]] | name day = | derived = | popularity = | footnotes = }} '''Danilo''' ([[Cyrillic script]]: Данило) is a male given name meaning "[[God]] is my judge" in [[Hebrew language|Hebrew]]. It's a very common given name in [[Italian language|Italian]], [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]], [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[Serbian language|Serbian]], and to some extent used in [[Ukrainian language|Ukrainian]] and [[Russian language|Russian]].
Notable people with the name include:
*[[Danilo Acosta]] (born 1997), Ecuadorian physician *[[Danilo Aceval]] (born 1975), Paraguayan footballer; *[[Danilo, Crown Prince of Montenegro|Danilo Aleksandar Petrović-Njegoš]] (1871–1939), crown prince of Montenegro; *[[Danilo Alves Rodrigues]] (born 1996), Brazilian footballer; *[[Danilo Alvim]] (1920–1996), Brazilian footballer; *[[Danilo Anderson]] (1966–2004), Venezuelan environmental state prosecutor; *[[Danilo Anđušić]] (born 1991), Serbian basketball player *[[Danilo Aparecido da Silva]] (born 1986), Brazilian footballer *[[Danilo Arona]] (active since 1994), Italian writer; *[[Danilo Arrieta]] (born 1987), Chilean-Danish footballer; *[[Danilo Astori]] (born 1940), Uruguayan politician; *[[Danilo Atienza]] (active 1974–1989), Filipino pilot; *[[Danilo Bach]] (born 1944), American screenwriter and film producer *[[Danilo Barbosa]] (born 1996), Brazilian footballer *[[Danilo Bertazzi]] (born 1966), Italian actor *[[Danilo Blanuša]] (1903–1987), Yugoslavian mathematician and physicist *[[Danilo Cintra]] (born 1985), Brazilian footballer *[[Danilo Cirino de Oliveira]] (born 1986), Brazilian footballer *[[Danilo Clementino]] (born 1982), naturalized Equatoguinean footballer *[[Danilo Donati]] (1926–2001), Italian costume designer *[[Danilo Gabriel de Andrade]] (born 1979), Brazilian footballer *[[Danilo Gallinari]] (born 1988), Italian basketball player; *[[Danilo Gentili]] (born 1979), Brazilian reporter and comedian; *[[Danilo Golubović]] (born 1963), Serbian politician *[[Danilo I, Metropolitan of Cetinje]] (1670–1735) *[[Danilo I, Prince of Montenegro]] (1826–1860), Prince-Bishop of Montenegro *[[Danilo Ikodinović]] (born 1976), Serbian water polo player *[[Danilo Ilić]] (1891–1815), Serbian revolutionary *[[Danilo Kocevski]] (born 1947), Macedonian writer *[[Danilo Larangeira]] (born 1984), Brazilian footballer *[[Danilo Lazović]] (1951–2006), Serbian actor *[[Danilo Pereira (Portuguese footballer)]] (born 1991), Portuguese footballer *[[Danilo (footballer, born April 1991)]] (born 1991), Brazilian footballer *[[Danilo (footballer, born July 1991)]] (born 1991), Brazilian footballer *[[Danilo Medina]] (born 1951), President of the Dominican Republic since 2012 *[[Danilo Pantić]] (born 1996), Serbian footballer *[[Danilo Pennone]] (born 1963), Italian writer; *[[Danilo Pérez]] (born 1965), Panamanian jazz pianist and composer; *[[Danilo Stojković]] (1934–2002), Serbian actor *[[Danilo Šerbedžija]] (born 1971), Serbian film director *[[Danilo Veron Bairros]] (born 1987), Brazilian footballer *[[Marcos Danilo Padilha]] (1985–2016), Brazilian footballer *[[Danilo Alexandre Moreira Silva Santos]] (born 1990), UK Music Artist
==See also== *[[Danylo (disambiguation)]] *[[Danilović]] *[[Danilov (disambiguation)]] *[[Danilovsky (disambiguation)]] *[[Danilovo]] *[[Danilo culture]], Neolithic archaeological culture of [[Prehistoric Croatia]]
